DataElement.preferredName: Smoking PATH Snus Risk Perception Questionnaire 4 Other Smokeless Tobacco Comparison Use Harmfulness Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they?ve quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time._A moist powder tobacco product that is used by placing it under the upper lip for extended periods._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._A predetermined set of questions._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI)_Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff._The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences._A set of descriptors to assess the relative perceived harmfulness of something.

Property.preferredName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study Snus Risk Perception Questionnaire Other Smokeless Tobacco Comparison Use
Property.preferredDefinition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.:A moist powder tobacco product that is used by placing it under the upper lip for extended periods.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.:A predetermined set of questions.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff.:The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.longName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study
Concepts.definition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.
A moist powder tobacco product that is used by placing it under the upper lip for extended periods.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff.
The examination of two or more people or things in order to detect similarities and differences.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of descriptors to assess the relative perceived harmfulness of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is using snus less harmful, a
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is using snus less harmful, about the same, or more harmful than other types of smokeless tobacco products (such as dip, spit or chew)?
